versions.name: Game Boy Pocket
versions.summary:
A smaller, lighter unit that required fewer batteries.

The Game Boy Pocket has a smaller link port, which requires an adapter to link with the older Game Boy. Takes two AAA batteries.
versions.graphics: 160x144 pixels screen with 2-bit a black-and-white display screen
versions.sound: 2 pulse wave generators, 1 PCM 4-bit wave sample (64 4-bit samples played in 1×64 bank or 2×32 bank) channel, 1 noise generator, and one audio input from the cartridge
versions.connectivity: 2 Game Boys can be linked together via built-in serial ports, up to 4 with a DMG-07 4-player adapter. And 16 in maximum.
versions.resolutions: a 65 mm (2.56 in) diagonal, 48.5 mm (1.91 in) width, and 43.5 mm (1.71 in) height screen

versions.name: Game Boy Light
versions.summary:
"The Game Boy Light is a backlit and updated version of the Game Boy Pocket exclusively released in Japan"

Has a larger battery compartment because it requires two AA batteries instead of AAA batteries.

versions.name: Initial version
versions.graphics: 160x144 pixels, 66 mm (2.6 in) diagonal screen with 2-bit (4 shades of "gray" {light to very dark olive green})
versions.sound: 2 pulse wave generators, 1 PCM 4-bit wave sample (64 4-bit samples played in 1×64 bank or 2×32 bank) channel, 1 noise generator, and one audio input from the cartridge
versions.connectivity: 2 Game Boys can be linked together via built-in serial ports, up to 4 with a DMG-07 4-player adapter. And 16 in maximum.
